data.text: The word of the Lord which came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Gentiles;

against Egypt, against the army of Pharaoh-necho king of Egypt, which was by the river Euphrates in Carchemish, which Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon smote in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah.
Order ye the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.
Harness the horses; and get up, ye horsemen,
Wherefore have I seen them dismayed and turned away back?
Let not the swift flee away, nor the mighty man escape;
Who is this that cometh up as a flood,
Egypt riseth up like a flood,
Come up, ye horses; and rage, ye chariots;
For this is the day of the Lord God of hosts,
Go up into Gilead, and take balm,
The nations have heard of thy shame,
The word that the Lord spake to Jeremiah the prophet, how Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon should come and smite the land of Egypt.
Declare ye in Egypt, and publish in Migdol,
Why are thy valiant men swept away?
He made many to fall,
They did cry there, Pharaoh king of Egypt is but a noise;
As I live, saith the King,
O thou daughter dwelling in Egypt,
Egypt is like a very fair heifer,
Also her hired men are in the midst of her like fatted bullocks;
The voice thereof shall go like a serpent;
They shall cut down her forest, saith the Lord,
The daughter of Egypt shall be confounded;
The Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, saith;
And I will deliver them into the hand of those that seek their lives,
But fear not thou, O my servant Jacob,
Fear thou not, O Jacob my servant,
